verses.text: 提幔人以利法回答說：

words.note: A person from Teman, a region in Edom.

verses.text: 「智慧人怎可用虛空的知識來回答呢？怎可用東風充滿自己的肚腹呢？

words.note: Short for 怎麼, often used in rhetorical questions.
Frequently used in Ecclesiastes for vanity or emptiness.
Indicates purpose or means before a verb.
Short for 怎麼, often used in rhetorical questions.
In biblical contexts, often refers to a scorching, destructive wind.
More formal than 肚子 (dùzi).

verses.text: 他怎可用無益的話，或無用的言詞辯論呢？

words.note: Short for 怎麼, often used in rhetorical questions.

verses.text: 你還廢棄了敬畏 神的心，攔阻了在 神面前的默禱。

words.note: Indicates completion or change of state.
Often refers to reverential fear of God.
The leading space is a traditional way to show respect for God.
Indicates completion or change of state.
The leading space is a traditional way to show respect for God.
Often used figuratively to mean 'in the presence of'.
默 (mò) means 'silent', 禱 (dǎo) is short for 禱告 (dǎogào, pray).

verses.text: 你的罪孽教導你的口，你採用詭詐人的舌頭，

words.note: Refers to deep-seated sin or wickedness.
詭詐 (guǐzhà) means cunning or deceitful.

verses.text: 是你的口定你的罪，不是我，你嘴唇作見證控告你。

words.note: Here means 'to condemn' or 'to declare guilty'.
Often refers to moral/religious sin in biblical context.
A common verb-object compound in legal or religious contexts.

verses.text: 你是頭一個生下來的人嗎？你在諸山未有之前誕生的嗎？

words.definition: to be born, to come into existence

words.note: A more literary or archaic way to say 'all/many mountains'.
Refers to a state of non-existence or before creation.

words.definition: to be born, to come into being
words.note: Often used for formal or significant births/creations.

verses.text: 你曾聆聽過 神的密旨嗎？你可以獨佔智慧嗎？

words.note: More formal than just '聽'.
The sacred space is a convention in some Bible editions.
Refers to a divine, hidden plan or command.
A key concept in wisdom literature like Job.

verses.text: 有甚麼是你知道，我們不知道的呢？你明白，我們不明白的呢？

words.note: Implies a rhetorical question or a challenge.

verses.text: 我們中間有白頭髮的，又有年紀老的，年歲比你的父親還大。

words.note: Indicates 'the one with white hair'.
Indicates 'the one who is old'.
Often used for a person's age, similar to 年紀.
Used here to emphasize the degree of comparison ('even older').

verses.text: 神的安慰對你是否太少？溫柔的言語對你是否不足？
你的心為甚麼迷惑你，你的眼為甚麼閃出怒光，

words.note: A specific poetic phrase for an angry look.

verses.text: 以致你的心靈轉過來抗拒 神，從你的口中竟發出這樣的話？

words.definition: so that, with the result that

words.note: Common outside religious texts, but here implies spiritual essence.

words.definition: to turn around, to turn back

verses.text: 人是甚麼，能算為潔淨嗎？婦人所生的，能算為公義嗎？

words.note: A key biblical concept related to ritual and moral purity.
所 + verb structure forms a nominalized phrase.
A fundamental concept in Christian theology.

verses.text: 神不信任他的眾天使，在他看來，諸天也不潔淨，

words.definition: to trust, to have confidence in

words.note: Used before nouns to indicate plurality or multitude.
Literally 'heavenly messenger'.
Forms a fixed phrase '在...看來' meaning 'in ...'s opinion'.
A formal or poetic term for the heavens.
A key biblical concept related to ritual and moral purity.

verses.text: 何況那可憎又腐敗，喝罪孽如同喝水的世人呢？

words.note: Indicates something is even more true/obvious.
Often used in a moral or religious context.
Can refer to moral corruption or physical decay.
Stronger connotation than '罪' alone, implies deep evil.
Often implies humanity in contrast to God or spiritual beings.

verses.text: 我要告訴你，你要聽我說。我所看見的，我要述說，

words.note: Indicates the object of a verb; forming a nominal clause.
Turns a verb phrase into a noun phrase, 'that which is seen'.
More formal than '說' or '講'.

verses.text: 就是智慧人所傳講的，並沒有隱瞞從他們列祖所領受的。

words.note: Refers to those possessing divine or worldly wisdom.
Indicates the agent of a verb; forming a nominal clause.
Commonly used for proclaiming religious messages.
Turns a verb phrase into a noun phrase, 'that which is preached'.
Used to emphasize a negative statement.
Frequently used in the Bible to refer to the patriarchs.
Indicates the object of a verb; forming a nominal clause.
Often used for receiving divine revelations or teachings.
Turns a verb phrase into a noun phrase, 'that which is received'.

verses.text: 這地唯獨賜給列祖，並沒有外族人從他們中間經過。

words.note: Emphasizes exclusivity.
Formal term for giving, often from a superior to an inferior.
Frequently used in the Bible to refer to the patriarchs.
Used to emphasize a negative statement.
Distinguishes from the chosen people/nation, often Israelites.

verses.text: 惡人一生飽受痛苦，一生的年數都為強暴留存。

words.note: A common term in the Bible for those who oppose God's ways.
Emphasizes enduring a great deal of something (usually negative).
Often refers to one's allotted time on earth.
Refers to physical violence or oppressive power.
Implies something set aside or kept for a specific purpose/fate.

verses.text: 恐怖之聲常在他的耳中，太平的時候，強盜就來襲擊他。

words.note: Classical possessive or attributive particle.

verses.text: 他不信他能從黑暗中轉回，自己留給刀劍殺害。

words.note: Often refers to cutting weapons in general.

verses.text: 他飄流覓食說：『哪裡有呢？』他知道黑暗的日子已經臨近了。

words.note: Often implies aimless wandering.
Often used for animals, but here for a person in dire straits.
Indicates completion or change of state.

verses.text: 患難與困苦使他驚惶，又勝過他，像君王預備上陣攻擊一樣。

words.note: Common in biblical context for trials.
Often follows a comparison with 像.

verses.text: 因為他向 神揮拳，向全能者逞強，

words.note: Often capitalized or preceded by a space in Bibles for reverence.

words.definition: brandish a fist, throw a punch

words.note: A title for God, literally 'the all-able one'.

verses.text: 用盾牌的厚凸面，硬著頸項向他直闖。

words.note: Often used idiomatically with 頸項 (neck).

verses.text: 因為他以自己的脂肪蒙臉，腰上積滿肥油。
他住在被毀的城邑裡，住在沒有人居住，注定快要成為亂堆的房屋裡。

words.note: More formal/literary than 城市 (chéngshì).

verses.text: 他不再富足，他的財富不能持久，他的產業也不得在地上擴張，

words.note: In biblical context, often refers to inheritance or patrimony.

verses.text: 他不能離開黑暗，火燄必燒乾他的嫩枝，他必因 神口中的氣而離去。

words.note: The preceding ideogram '　' is a reverential marker.
Contextually refers to God's life-giving or destroying breath/spirit.

verses.text: 他不信靠虛假，自己欺騙自己，因為虛假必成為他的報應。

words.note: Refers to consequences for actions, often negative.

verses.text: 他的日期未到以先，這事必成全，他的枝子，也不青綠。

words.note: Often used to indicate 'before X happens'.
Often refers to fulfilling a divine plan or prophecy.

verses.text: 他必像葡萄樹未熟的葡萄掉落一樣，又如橄欖樹的花朵一開就謝一般。

words.note: Used with 像 or 如 to mean 'just like'.
Part of the '一...就...' (as soon as... then...) construction.
Part of the '一...就...' (as soon as... then...) construction.
Used to convey a general manner or resemblance.

verses.text: 因為不敬虔的人必不能生育，火必吞滅收受賄賂者的帳幕。

words.note: In this context, '不敬虔' means ungodly.
Implies receiving something undesirable, like a bribe.
Suffix forming a noun meaning 'one who does X'.

verses.text: 他們所懷的是罪惡，所生的是罪孽，他們腹中所預備的是詭詐。」

words.note: Forms nominalized phrases, e.g., 'that which is X-ed'.
Used here to nominalize the '所 + verb' phrase.
Forms nominalized phrases, e.g., 'that which is X-ed'.
Used here to nominalize the '所 + verb' phrase.
Refers to evil deeds or the karmic consequence of sin.
Figuratively means 'in their innermost being' or 'schemes'.
Forms nominalized phrases, e.g., 'that which is X-ed'.
Used here to nominalize the '所 + verb' phrase.
